content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is a function in Julia to clean column names as requested:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    # lowercase the string
    col = lowercase(col) 
    
    # strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    col = strip(col)
    
    # replace spaces and hyphens with underscore
    col = replace(col, " " => "_")
    col = replace(col, "-" => "_")
    
    return col
end
```

This function takes a string as an argument and applies the transformations to it. The `lowercase`, `strip`, and `replace` functions are built-in Julia functions that perform lowercasing, stripping of whitespace, and replacement of characters respectively. You can use this function on any column name you want to clean in your data.
